text:
(Mac User) Hi everyone,

I’m new to HubSpot CMS design manager, just now trying to set up a local dev folder for the custom quotes I need to make.
I did everything on the HubSpot dev page, as far as init and fetching goes, everything works but the actual server itself.

I tried an http-server where I served the whole folder, navigated to the file I wanted to see, but it’s not actually compiled…

How can I setup my local Vs code to be able to visualize the changes?

ty^^
Not sure if this addresses what you are asking but I push everything to HS and view it there.

Example I create a new template on my local environment and it is pushed to HS using "hs watch". Then I go to the template view it in the viewer or create a page using the template to view. Then I just refresh when wanting to see the changes as I work.
Hope that helps.
^ that's what you have to do. HubL can't render locally
Also when working on some assets such as themes when you are using watch it will give a link upon save where you can preview the page.
Look up about 6 questions above you will see a read arrow pointing to an example.
I haven't worked with custom quotes.

Hello everyone.
Can someone please help me with the issue I am facing.
I am trying to integrate HubSpot to pull data from my react app. But I am unable to find the useful information how this can be achieved.
<@U02162GK9SP> building with react on HubSpot

React, Vue and other JavaScript frameworks can be used on HubSpot, we even have boilerplates for Vue and React to get you up and running quickly. We have a doc about what you should know when using frameworks on HubSpot and info on getting started: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/js-frameworks>
<@U024X6JLDEH> that doc explains how you can use our APIs in your react app

I'm a bot, here 24/7 to help you with HubSpot development questions. The hope is that over time I can answer a lot of the most common HubSpot development questions. Unfortunately I'm never going to be able to analyze your code, inspect your site, or piece together a solution to a complicated multi-faceted issue. What I can do is talk about concepts of the HubSpot platform and often point you toward some useful related resources. Hopefully over time I will be able to help troubleshoot issues developers run into. To get started feel free to ask me a question like "what is a theme?", "How can I make my site faster?" or "How do I install the CLI?"

I'm new and very much still learning, so I apologize if I don't always answer your question correctly but the more conversations I have the better I will get over time.

Hey there, that command is a recent addition let me check with the marketplace folks, once I find the answer I’ll post it here, as well as update the bot. That way the next person to ask that will get an answer straight away.
The functionality is currently only in the beta version. of the CLI. I am waiting to hear back on the command names.

Is there a plan to have this "testing preview" feature work in the website preview instead of the design manager preview?
```When working in your development environment, it is safe to use the watch command to automatically upload changes when you save files in your text editor to rapidly develop. If you use the Design Manager "Live preview with display options" tool for a template, as you save changes, you will automatically see them reflected in the rendered output of the template preview. To view the live preview of a template, select Preview > Live Preview with display options within the template editor of the Design Manager. ```
<@U7SL518D6> Thank you so much
I believe my problem statement is little different.. I have a form in my react app, I want to submit that form data in HubSpot as a contact details using HubSpot API

<@U7SL518D6> This is the form and details I am asking my users to submit.. I want as soon as user clicks the button, the details should be sent to HubSpot and create a contact with these details just like contact is created upon submitting HubSpot form.
